page.title: 18Forestry in Wash Common
page.content: We interviewed a Senior Ranger 1, who has been with the Forestry Commission since 1962 and a Senior Ranger 1 for 16 years. His job is wildlife conservation, protection of forest crops and protecting the land adjoining his from damage from rabbits, squirrels and deer. This Ranger is responsable for 7-8,000 acres over 33 woods including Penwood in our block. These are mainly Pine and Oak trees and the animals include, Fallow deer, Roe deer, foxes, rabbits and muntjak. He has a Landrover with fire fighting gear and 5 beaters. We asked if he has trouble with people disobeying bye laws and he said he finds illegal horse riding, motor cycling, camping and lighting fires. At 11pm when we are all in bed he goes to check on the woods from special platforms even if it is raining.
